attributes.action: UK Government to allow people to only claim asylum from UK Embassy's
attributes.background: I want this to be debated in parliament because i believe this will save people using dangerous methods in trying to reach the UK mainland from places like Calais and also putting the lives of truck drivers at risk. It will also reduce funding for the criminal gangs taking advantage of their plight.

attributes.action: Allowing voluntary donations for NHS treatment, which are free at point of use.
attributes.background: I'm proud of our NHS and I would like to ensure we maintain a free at point of use NHS for future generations. Allowing voluntary contributions would help to secure vital NHS services. No one would be obliged or pressured to make these contributions, they would be on a strictly voluntary basis only.

attributes.action: Force news outlets to place more prominent apologies in publications.
attributes.background: Many publications make errors with what they print. Mistakes are fine, but apologies to those affected are often hidden or obscured from the publication's readers. This should be changed as many readers will never see the apology which causes unfair complications for those implicated by the mistake
attributes.additional_details:
Publications such as The Sun and The Mirror hide their corrections in a separate part of their website. See the Imgur link below:

http://imgur.com/a/uD6Bd

But plenty of other publications do the same thing. Apologies should be prominently placed on the homepage of every publication. This will reduce the number of errors publications make as their mistakes will be more easily noticed and scrutinized much more closely.

attributes.action: Redirect funds from accommodation of increasing road traffic to its reduction
attributes.background: Road traffic in the UK, similarly to many other countries around the world, is drastically increasing and causing irreparable global damage. We need to redirect funding of roadworks which seek to accommodate the increase, to funding of mass infrastructure allowing people cheap and efficient travel.
attributes.additional_details:
Electric bullet trains currently operational in parts of Asia are cheap, fast, eco-friendly and efficient. In the UK, infrastructure is an embarrassment which costs our pockets and the environment dearly. 

With investment in mass infrastructure development, we no longer allow the urgent concerns over CO2 emissions to be in the hands of time-restricted car consumers and money-hungry suppliers and, instead, raise this issue to the level of a national emergency.

attributes.action: Cameron to openly support the Kurdish people and sanction Turkish goverment.
attributes.background: The Turkish Goverment continues to attack the Kurdish people and course servier Human Rights abuse. We the undersigned feel that the UK goverment should applie sanctions on the Turkish Goverment untill these attacks stop.

attributes.action: Allow uk citizens to view their progress of their tax rebate online
attributes.background: The amount of times my tax code has been changed incorrectly I've rang up to sort it out and later on rang again to check and there was no record of my previous call. In one occasion they debited my pay total in 2 months 800pound i would like it easier to some how log online to view the progress
attributes.additional_details: To be able to log online and check the status of a tax rebate  or if any money is due or owed I'm sure many other people feel the same way as to phone usually takes a minimum of 30 minutes on hold to get through. Once a women told me they didn't owe me anything I was debating it for 20 minutes and then she said oh yh I was looking at the wrong box. What would of happened if I said ok ??

attributes.action: restore the definition of fuel poverty to spending 10% of income
attributes.background: When parliament voted to end fuel poverty by 2016 the definition of fuel poverty was needing to spend more than 10% of your income. Since then the definition has been changed; this omits people at risk  being included in the figures & makes it unclear whether the target agreed in 2000 is being met.
attributes.additional_details: Prof David Gordon of the university of Bristol states that estimates suggest that 20% of the population are now fuel poor and that by the original definition of needing to spend more than 10% of income the numbers of fuel poor have been steadily rising.Rather than being eradicated by 2016 it appears that fuel poverty as debated and voted in parliament has doubled. BBC broadcast their research on "Panorama; too poor to be warm" on 21st March 2016.

attributes.action: Equal rights for ex-Students who took out a Student Loan before 2006.
attributes.background: If you took out a Student Loan before 2006 and don't earn enough to pay it back, it stays with you with amassing interest until your 65th Birthday. If you took your loan out after 2006 it's written off after 25 years or when you're about 46 years old. This is unfair and ageist, equal rights now!!
attributes.additional_details: http://www.slc.co.uk/services/loan-repayment/loan-cancellation.aspx

attributes.action: Only allow reducted sentences for those prisoners who plead guilty immediately.
attributes.background: Prisoners have their sentence reduced by a third if they admit their guilt at the 'first opportunity'. In practice they receive this reduction even if they wait until court to plead guilty - wasting vast amounts of police time. This reduction should only be for those who admit guilt before charge.

attributes.action: Scrap emission based VED on private vehicles as it takes no account of miles pa
attributes.background:
Emission based VED takes no account of mileage.
A high VED vehicle paying £505 pa may only do 3000 miles pa and another vehicle paying £120 pa 20,000 miles pa
Have a basic VED for all  private vehicles incl electric and the rest  funded by tax on fuel for a pro rata rate of road usage

attributes.action: Use the sugar tax to heavily subsidise or make fitness activities free in the UK
attributes.background: The goverment keeps reminding us about obesity & how we should become more active well wouldnt it be better if the sugar tax was used to heavily subsidise sometimes expensive Gym, fitness activities and so give people incentives to become more active and in turn this could take pressure off the NHS

attributes.action: Make Gift Aid, transparent and accountable to the general public
attributes.background:
Gift Aid accounts for over £4 billion a year in government subsidy to
registered charities in the United Kingdom. This payment is neither
transparent nor able to be scruitinised by the general public.
attributes.additional_details: A recent FOI (Freedom of Information) request to the Treasury regarding Gift Aid was not possible, even by going through official channels (including through my local Member of Parliament). This petition is to open up the Gift Aid Mechanism to greater transparency, ensuring the destination(s) and amount(s) of this effective Government subsidy, is made readily available to the general public, enabling greater scrutiny of these funds and the organisations which receive this funding.

attributes.action: Confiscate the mobile phones of drivers caught using one whilst driving.
attributes.background: Give the police the power to confiscate the mobile phones of drivers caught using one whilst driving. (Not hands free). This will be more of a deterrent than any fines, cautions or points.

attributes.action: Spend more money on United Learning to save our children's education.
attributes.background: United Learning are struggling to keep good qualified teachers such as a member of the KBA Geography department because they can't afford to out pay other schools so children's education may suffer if amazing teachers such as he who is mentioned above are lost to schools without a proper curriculum.
attributes.additional_details: We think the government should pay United Learning more funds to preserve the next generation's education. This means that more children will be drawn to technology to try and replace the awful replacement teachers and therefore damaging their chances of a good education and furthermore a good life.

attributes.action: Allow Pensioners free dental treament
attributes.background: In the UK dental treatment is costly even on the NHS. Bad teeth are a significant cause of ill health. The NHS should look carefully at the damage charges do to pensioners health and others on reduced incomes.

attributes.action: National Travel Ban on Foreign Anti-gay Officials
attributes.background: Senator Jeane Shaheen recently introduced legislation that would deny entry into the United States to non-citizens who are involved in the persecution of LGBTI people around the world. I believe this is a fantastic idea and believe the UK should have this in place also.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.gaystarnews.com/article/us-democrats-propose-national-travel-ban-on-foreign-anti-gay-officials/#gs.GCsU1ko

attributes.action: Provide textbook grants for all students in key stage 4 and above.
attributes.background: For many students the high cost of basic curriculum textbooks means they cannot afford to access vital information needed to achieve their full potential. A single a-level physics textbook costs £40 -which acts as a massive discriminatory burden on less wealthy students and families.
attributes.additional_details: As a student I have realised the burden of these costs; a single textbook is rarely the only material needed and additional workbooks and revision guides add to the mounting costs. The continually changing curriculum means most second hand textbooks are no longer fit for purpose forcing students to buy new. I believe the education gap between the wealthy and less so can be attributed to costs such as these, and providing a grant would help each young adult achieve their full capabilities.

attributes.action: Stop the cost of theory tests especially when people fail on one thing
attributes.background: My  Grandaughter has spent £180 and has failed on one thing this is without the cost of driving lessons, people are complaining but nobody seems to be doing anything.

attributes.action: Intervene in Crimea and return it to the Ukraine Government
attributes.background:
Russia has annexed Crimea and have claimed it since 2014. Two years later and no action has been taken. 

2,423 killed, 6,820 wounded, 378 missing and 2,768 people captured as a result of Russian Military Intervention. 

Economic sanctions are not enough. Action is needed.

attributes.action: Britain must evacuate all children from the refugee camps in Northern France.
attributes.background:
Evacuate every child under the age of 16, effective immediately. 
These are innocent children. They must be saved.

There are lots of compassionate people in the UK, willing to take on a refugee child. We will literally open up our front doors. Our towns, villages, cities. Our homes.
attributes.additional_details:
This is not a topic that we should even be discussing. As a nation of good people. We see that there must be ways to house, feed and most importantly educate these children who are currently living in terrible and life threatening conditions in Northern France. We cannot stand by and watch them die. There are spare beds here. 

This is the opportunity to do the right thing, as a nation, united. 

Remember the Kindertransport. Lives saved.

We, the undersigned, will foster a refugee child

attributes.action: Create Stricter Laws On Laser Attacks On Aircraft.
attributes.background: Laser attacks on aircraft have been on the rise in the UK and other countries globally. These severe attacks can disorientate pilots along with dazzling, distracting and even incapacitate them. The lasers involved are have been made very affordable and available increasing laser attacks as a result.

attributes.action: Create more facilities for those with mental health issues
attributes.background: Those with mental illness are often forced to take up hospital beds miles away from where they live, this can be disstressing in a time when they need the most support.
attributes.additional_details: Recreational facilities are created almost everyday, these are not a necessity!! Health is more important yet money is so often wasted! Nobody wants to be alone at such desperate times, but sometimes the distance of theses hospitals forces it to be more difficult; some of these sufferers have to spend nights in jail cells because these facilities are so limited.

attributes.action: Cap the amount phone companies can charge if you go outside of your allowance.
attributes.background: Apply a limit to the amount of money phone companies can charge you if you go outside of your contracted allowance to avoid shock bills in the hundreds or thousands of pounds arriving unexpectedly and landing the victim in financial difficulty.
attributes.additional_details: A recent example is that a young girl of age 16 recently cancelled a contract with 5 days remaining. Those 5 days were refunded and she went on a pay as you go contract for those 5 days - this was not communicated to the parents. At the end of the month, a £1400 bill came through as the charge per mb of data was set at £7.20. This is UNETHICAL and there is no logical reason data should be this expensive. It is an example of pure greed and something needs to be done to protect the public.

attributes.action: Become Founding Members  of a organisation called The New  Common Market
attributes.background: a new organisation ,  with no overriding political supremacy or involvement , with  any controlling input being from democratically elected representative , Each member having and retaining  its own sovereign control on all other non trade sovereign  government and legislature
attributes.additional_details: There are other countries who are locked in this E.U. domineering existence who no doubt would want to revert to and join this out of hand situation and  if there are sufficient to be founder members then the present regime is finished  or will only survive as a shadow of what it has formed itself into

attributes.action: Make it law to require all insurance companies to fit "black boxes" to vehicles.
attributes.background: I'm calling on the Government to require all insurance companies to fit black boxes to vehicles. This will create cheaper premiums for safer drivers as well as encouraging more people to improve the safety and standard of their driving.
attributes.additional_details: More information about black boxes can be found here - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-20143969

attributes.action: Stop disabled drivers being charged for parking in on/off street car parks.
attributes.background: I recently received a parking charge notice stating that I had contravened the parking terms and conditions of a car park. Upon investigating the terms and conditions I noted that there were no disabled concessions allowed. I find this unacceptable as disabled drivers often require concession.
attributes.additional_details: The blue badge scheme was designed to facilitate disabled drivers getting closer to their destination due to their disability. Most councils have made concessions for disabled drivers to park free of charge on/off street, however it seems that privately operated car parks (which are most retail parks and supermarkets) are being allowed to waiver the concession rights of disabled drivers. I want this to change so that disabled concession of free parking applies to all on/off street parking.

attributes.action: Ban utility companies from charging existing customers more than new customers.
attributes.background: Ever had your internet/gas/electricity/insurance renewal quote come back much higher than you were paying? Wasted time phoning up just to get nowhere? Looked online to see much cheaper offers exist and spent ages switching just to have it all happen again next year? Ban this waste of time and money!
attributes.additional_details:
There is no reason why people should be charged a higher price just because they are an existing customer.
Utility companies offer cheap rates to attract new customers but they rip-off existing customers by pushing up the price each year; knowing many people won't bother switching.
Force companies to automatically roll-out the best offer available to all customers with a given profile and penalise if not done.
This wouldn't affect loyalty discounts for existing customers or no-claims bonuses.

attributes.action: All residents should pay full council tax regardless of employment status.
attributes.background:
Everyone without exception should be required by law to pay full council tax for services they utilise. We feel that the working citizen is unfairly treated.

Council services are over stretched because of the lack of contribution from the low income members of society

attributes.action: Open up Transgender bathrooms
attributes.background: I would like for you to open up Transgender toilets around the UK so that people like me can go to the bathroom in public without having to feel awkward about who we are. It should be for both male and female trans people to use.
attributes.additional_details:
As a personal story, I always feel awkward going to use the female bathrooms in public places because it's uncomfortable feeling as if I'm not supposed to be there. And I know others will feel that way too. 
If we opened up the bathrooms, there would be less nervous people going into the bathrooms that they are not feeling assigned to.

attributes.action: Improve broadband bandwidths in all areas of London
attributes.background: Especially rural, improving broadband bandwidths would take a lot of cars off the roads and even make employers to allow workers to work from home, meaning big structural changes can be reassessed. Saving on commuting costs, would allow people to have more to spend.
attributes.additional_details: As a country having a lot of problems domestically, especially with immigrants, asylum seekers and economy, we should fund new ways to deal with future demands. By employing a boost in broadband bandwidths as an initiative we can take a long step towards managing our problems and even help those in need by reducing unnecessary expenses like Australia and Denmark have done before.

attributes.action: Agree with European governments to radical plan to prevent drowning of refugees
attributes.background: We call on the UK Government and Parliament to work with other countries to adopt a radical plan to stop the drowning of Syrian refugees. People were horrified by the picture of the drowned boy on the beach but the drownings are still happening. We must have a plan which starts by ending tragedies.
attributes.additional_details:
Our radical plan: 
1) Naval rescue of refugees from Turkish beaches. 
2) Registration of rescued refugees and issuing of Temporary Refugee (TR) status identity cards. 
3) Temporary distribution of TRs to European countries. 
This will require: Suspension of current European legislation on refugees, management by UNHCR and recognition that refugees are being offered a temporary sanctuary NOT a permanent home. We believe that most TRs will want to return once peace is established in their country.

attributes.action: Ban software that allows child abuse material to be shared
attributes.background: This is a petition to stop child abuse material online being transferred and shared. Their are a number of specific programs and software which allow this and promote this. and i believe if we can stop, close, ban these software then we can minimize the influence it has both now and in the future.
attributes.additional_details: I have substantial evidence to support my petition. I feel we have to act now to make sure we minimize any influence this will have on all people and vulnerable persons now and for all of our future generations. These programs and software are vital tools for the people to use to influence the vulnerable and easily susceptible to influence. We must come together now and get these stopped before the material has influence more people and children. Please help me to minimize this.

attributes.action: Make more money available for grass roots football and artificial pitches.
attributes.background: More money needs to be made available for grass roots football. We need to make it more accessible to the general public and need more artificial pitches that can be used in all conditions, for teaching the next generation, weekend leagues and just general use.

attributes.action: Allow a petition starter to address parliament when a petition is to be debated
attributes.background: Currently a petition is debated upon its merits in a committee or house when it reaches it's 100,000 threshold. Democracy would be seen to be done if the petition  starter was part of the debate from the outset to represent all the signatories.
attributes.additional_details: The UK has a history of inviting even foreign dignitaries to address different areas of parliament. It is now time for petitions which reach 100,000 signatories to have their starting petitioner invited to parliament to address the start of the debate. If he/she would rather appoint a proxy then that too should be offered.

attributes.action: Investigate and amend laws on selling generic drugs as expensive brands.
attributes.background: Many pharmaceutical companies sell medications which are available as generics for extortionate prices. One example of this is Ibruprofen, which is still sold under different brands for many times the price.
attributes.additional_details: You can purchase Ibruprofen 200mg tablets x 16 at a supermarket for 0.16p. You can purchase Nurofen from the same supermarket, same dosage and quantity for in excess of £2.00. Nurofen is the same medicine as Ibruprofen but marketed under a different brand.

attributes.action: Deny visas to diplomats' spouses from countries that ignore Same Sex marriage.
attributes.background:
Many UK citizens have got married to non-Europeans/Brits under British same sex 'marriage'. 

When they return to these countries, the document and marriage is void- yet - it the same institution and certificate as a heterosexual marriage.
attributes.additional_details: Why should Ambassadors enjoy a freedom they deny others?

attributes.action: Make all cyclists and horse riders wear hi-vis clothing whilst on the roads
attributes.background: Make it the law that all cyclists and horse riders should wear hi-vis clothing whilst riding on the roads. A lot of cyclists and horse riders on the roads don't get seen until the last minute due to not wearing suitable clothing, especially during dusk and dawn.
attributes.additional_details: Having appropriate high visibility clothing would make it safer if for them and car drivers, especially if for whatever reason they ride at night without lights on.

attributes.action: Reform the Education System to Ensure Quality of Education for All
attributes.background: One third of all schools are failing the Ofsted reports, Schools simply cannot get enough teachers and students are reaching out to personal tutors more than ever. Teachers are unwilling to enter the system due to immense workload, pressure and stress. We petition the government to reform the system
attributes.additional_details:
We hereby petition the government to:

Scrap the Teaching Qualification in favour of on the job qualifications. The retired and unemployed with the required knowledge can enter and teach at all schools.

Reduce the red tape in teaching, let the teachers teach not administrate.

Students should not be spoon fed but taught to learn. It is not on the teacher if some are unwilling to work.

Teachers should be able to teach at their own pace.

British qualifications should compare internationally.

attributes.action: Stop all taxation
attributes.background: Stop taxes for every thing

attributes.action: Block all foreign trade with the USA
attributes.background: It's looking likely Donald Trump is going to win the Presidency.  We need to officially let the people of the USA know that if this happens UK will honour all existing trade but block all future deals, in effect putting them on the naughty step.  We cannot be part of this farce.

attributes.action: Tax Corporations at the point of delivery, not where corporations are registered
attributes.background: Many Larger and multi national Companies are able to move money and  profits in order to minimize Tax liability. where as domestic companies and individuals proportionally pay much more.
attributes.additional_details: As many large companies are able to move money and profits global in order to minimize  tax liability and are able to make up their own Tax policy regardless of State Tax Laws it is now necessary to Tax Companies and Charge VAT on the goods they sell at the point of Delivery therefor forcing them to pay the same tax rates as other domestic companies. If they were to do this then A. the Tax burden normal Tax payers would reduce and it would mean that all are treated equally under the Law

attributes.action: I want national insurance payments stoped after 28years
attributes.background: I worked from 1977 till now I think it unfair to pay national insurance after you payed the full amount to recive my pension it an unfair tax on hard working men

attributes.action: Cut income tax further
attributes.background: We need to cut income tax further for the lowest paid families but ALSO the best paid (top rate of tax). Simple economics: lower tax = more revenue for the state as it further promotes business.

attributes.action: Use ASBO's to help clean up chewing gum in public places.
attributes.background: Many people think that spitting out chewing gum, randomly discarding cigarette butts, fast-food wrappers, used tissue, sweet papers, etc., is acceptable behaviour.  Help change that.

attributes.action: Charities trustees only allowed on for 5 years max then must come off for 5 yrs
attributes.background: to stop nepotism and cronyism

attributes.action: Make fathers in prison who have jobs pay something towards child Surport
attributes.background:
Fathers who have committed crime and are serving prison sentences should be made to pay some controbution towards costs for there children
People on benifits pay a small amount of child Surport and prisoners should be made to pay something similar from there wages

attributes.action: Prevent coffee from being sold to under 16 year olds
attributes.background:
A coffee shop served my 11 year old coffee without any adult being present. Apparently this is a done thing
Energy drinks have an age limit so therefore I feel something so high in caffeine should have the same restrictions.
Serving coffee to people so young without parents should not be allowed

attributes.action: Make it a requirement for all betting shops to have bandit screens
attributes.background: In recent months there has been a torrent of staff being raped, held at knife point and zero security for the staff working in betting shops and nothing has been done about this. It's time companies that run betting shops are held accountable for the safety of the staff they employ!
attributes.additional_details: Since the release of the new regulations from the government for gambling more and more staff are being put at risk by their employers including a staff member who was raped in a store and more recently members of staff and the public being held at knife point is becoming more and more frequent. No measures have been put in place to protect the staff. One member of staff was held at gunpoint while a robbery took place. It needs to be addressed NOW before people die!!

attributes.action: IMMIGRATION: Facilitate sponsors to revoke the indefinite status online
attributes.background: Spouse/partner of sponsors oftentimes change attitude once they receive an indefinite status in the U.K. The spouse should be able to make an application online and request for the application to be revoked if the marriage was on false grounds.
attributes.additional_details:
The ILR revocation should be done via paying fees depending on either having evidence or no evidence. 
Applications with no evidence will require investigation, and cost higher as Home Office will have  the to check if the spouse is still living together or separately,  the visa then will be temporally revoked until investigation is complete. In certain situations Citizenship should be stripped too. The partner shouldn't be permitted to obtain 50% investment share through land registry either.

attributes.action: Reinstate the SKILLED MIGRANT VISA to allow commonwealth citizens to work here
attributes.background: For too long COMMONWEALTH citizens (AUS/NZ/CAN etc) have been denied the necessary VISA to come and work in the UK,  denying the UK access to their skills, knowledge and innovation. This is now more necessary than ever in a BREXIT world, and the UK needs to maximise the potential of this resource
